pqueue module¶

class containers.pqueue.PQueue(elements=None)¶

Bases: object

Priority queue data structure. In a priority queue, an element with high priority is served before an element with low priority. If two elements have the same priority, they are served according to their order in the queue.

Note

Elements must be in the form of tuples. First element = value Second element = priority

Parameters:elements (list) – list of elements (optional)

Examples

>>> q1 = PQueue()
>>> q2 = PQueue([('baz', 3), ('foo', 1), ('bar', 2)])
>>> print(q1)
[]
>>> print(q2)
[('foo', 1), ('bar', 2), ('baz', 3)]
clear()¶

Clear all elements from the queue.

Examples

>>> q1 = PQueue([('baz', 3), ('foo', 1), ('bar', 2)])
>>> q1.clear()
>>> print(q1)
[]
dequeue()¶
Pop first element off queue and return.
Returns None if queue is empty.

Examples

>>> q1 = PQueue([('foo', 1), ('bar', 2), ('baz', 3)])
>>> v1 = q1.dequeue()
>>> print(v1)
('foo', 1)
>>> print(q1)
[('bar', 2), ('baz', 3)]
Returns:first element in queue or None
Return type:tuple
enqueue(value)¶

Inserts a new value to the end of the queue. Then sort by priority.

Parameters:value (tuple) – new element

Examples

>>> q1 = PQueue([('baz', 3), ('foo', 1)])
>>> q1.enqueue(('bar', 2))
>>> print(q1)
[('foo', 1), ('bar', 2), ('baz', 3)]
isEmpty()¶

Checks if queue is empty.

Examples

>>> q1 = PQueue([('foo', 1), ('bar', 2), ('baz', 3)])
>>> v1 = q1.isEmpty()
>>> print(v1)
False
>>> q2 = PQueue()
>>> v2 = q2.isEmpty()
>>> print(v2)
True
Returns:True or False
Return type:bool
peek()¶
Preview first element in queue.
Only returns None if queue is empty.

Examples

>>> q1 = PQueue([('foo', 1), ('bar', 2), ('baz', 3)])
>>> v1 = q1.peek()
>>> print(v1)
('foo', 1)
>>> q2 = PQueue()
>>> v2 = q2.peek()
>>> print(v2)
None
Returns:first element in queue or None
Return type:mixed
